required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Urogynecological and Sexual Functions After Vecchietti Operation
clinical_study.official_title: Urogynecological and Sexual Functions After Laparoscopic Vecchietti Vaginoplasty

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to establish the urogynecological and sexual functions after Vecchietti operation.

detailed_description.textblock: Thirteen patients with MRKHS who underwent laparoscopic Vecchietti vaginoplasty were included. A control group of 13 age-matched, childless, sexually active women were examined during the same period. All patients underwent the basic evaluation of anatomical outcomes. Sexual outcomes were established by polish validated FSFI questionnaire. Continence status was assessed by polish validated UDI-6 and IIQ-7 questionnaires. The UDI-6 is subdivided in three domains: stress incontinence, irritative and obstructive discomfort. The IIQ-7 measures the implications of urinary incontinence for normal daily functioning.

primary_outcome.description: assessment of sexual functions after Vecchietti operation with the use of The Female Sexual Function Index (FSFI) questionnaire
assessment of Urinary incontinence after Vecchietti operation with the use of the Urinary Distress Inventory (UDI 6) and the Incontinence Impact Questionnaire (IIQ 7)

arm_group.description: Thirteen patients with MRKHS who underwent laparoscopic Vecchietti vaginoplasty
A control group of 13 age-matched, childless, sexually active women

intervention.description: Patients who underwent laparoscopic Vecchietti vaginoplasty

study_pop.textblock: Thirteen patients with MRKHS who underwent laparoscopic Vecchietti vaginoplasty were included. A control group of 13 age-matched, childless, sexually active women were examined during the same period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with MRKHS who underwent laparoscopic Vecchietti vaginoplasty
- control group of 13 age-matched, childless, sexually active women
Exclusion Criteria:
- unability to understand informed consent
